primary.context: The caller wants to dispose of their timeshare property.
primary.detail: The agent attempted to transfer the caller to a representative for ownership sales, but the transfer failed due to no agents being available.

steps: Agent identified the intent as selling timeshare ownership.
Agent attempted to transfer to the concierge department.
Caller waited in a long queue for over 25 minutes.
Agent returned to the line stating no representatives were available.
Caller insisted on waiting or expressed frustration that the AI could not help.
Caller disconnected after being told waiting would not work.

failure.detail: The transfer failed because no human agents were available, and the AI's fallback logic (Turn 25) discouraged the caller from continuing to wait.

clarifications.note: Distinguishing between renting and selling ownership.

corrections.note: Caller corrected agent's assumption about renting.
Caller rejected agent's phrasing of selling 'week'.

loops.subject: selling vs renting
loops.note: Agent repeatedly asked for clarification on ownership disposal.

actions.detail: Transfer to concierge failed due to no availability.

insights.summary: The caller wanted to sell their timeshare ownership. The AI correctly identified this as out-of-scope and attempted a transfer, but the caller was left in a 25-minute queue only to be told no one was available.
insights.verbatim: There are no representatives available to take your call right now, so waiting will not connect you with someone.
insights.coaching: The agent's loop in turns 13-19 was repetitive; it should have proceeded to transfer sooner once 'sell ownership entirely' was stated in Turn 12. Additionally, the fallback message in Turn 25 is very discouraging to customers.
